between

[PLACEHOLDER], [PLACEHOLDER]
London SW1Y 5AD
(referred to as "Interested Party")
and
Staufenstraße 48
Frankfurt/ Main
Germany
(referred to as "[PLACEHOLDER]")
Preamble

Interested Party has indicated to [PLACEHOLDER] its serious interest in carrying out a due diligence for the purpose of acquiring a building complex in Hilpertstrasse 31 in 64295 Darmstadt (the "Proposed Transaction"), with 61,200 m² of leasable area.
The Interested Party asks for access to certain information relating to the Proposed Transaction.
By signing this Confidentiality Agreement the Interested Party agrees to be bound to the terms and conditions set forth in this Confidentiality Agreement (the "Confidentiality Agreement").
Definitions
In this Confidentiality Agreement

"Confidential Information" means all information relating to the Proposed Transaction or the Asset, whether oral, written, electronic or visual, which has been or will be provided by [PLACEHOLDER] and/or its Representatives to the Interested Party or one of its Representatives and which relates to the Proposed Transaction.

The term Confidential Information includes in particular (i) the fact that [PLACEHOLDER] and the Interested Party are evaluating the Proposed Transaction, (ii) the content of any and all investigations, discussions and negotiations in which the Interested Party or its Representatives participate in connection with the Proposed Transaction, and (iii) the existence and terms of this Confidentiality Agreement.

The term Confidential Information does not include information concerning which the Interested Party can prove that is (i) already generally available to the public or becomes generally available to the public in the future (other than as a result of a violation of this Confidentiality Agreement by the Interested Party or one of its Representatives), (ii) and is communicated to the Interested Party by a Third Party, provided that this does not interfere with the Confidentiality Agreement of the Interested Party or (iii) it was prepared independently by the Interested Party without the use of the Confidential Information.
"Representatives" of any party means such party's affiliates and that party´s and its affiliates´ directors, officers, employees and other representatives.
Confidentiality Agreement

The Interested Party will treat and keep the Confidential Information strictly as secret and confidential and will not, except as permitted herein, communicate or disclose the Confidential Information in any manner to any other person.
The Interested Party will not use the Confidential Information for any purpose other than directly in connection with the evaluation of the Proposed Transaction.
Permitted Disclosures of Confidential Information

The Interested Party undertakes to disclose the Confidential Information to its Representatives only if and to the extent that the knowledge of its Representatives about the Confidential Information is necessary for an appropriate evaluation of the Proposed Transaction, provided that such Representatives are either on the basis of their employment or service contracts, enforceable rules of conduct or individual confidentiality agreements subject to confidentiality obligations with respect to the Confidential Information equivalent in scope and nature to the confidentiality obligations hereunder.
Any other disclosure of Confidential Information is permitted only with the prior written consent of [PLACEHOLDER].
Mandatory Disclosure of Confidential Information

In the event that the Interested Party is required by law or court or governmental order to disclose any Confidential Information, the Interested Party will provide [PLACEHOLDER] - if legally permitted - with prompt written notice of such requirement.

Whether or not [PLACEHOLDER] instructs the Interested Party to seek an appropriate remedy, and whether or not such remedy is obtained, the Interested Party will disclose only that portion of the Confidential Information which is legally required to be disclosed.
Return of Documents
Any documents, data carriers and other materials in which Confidential Information is incorporated shall remain [PLACEHOLDER] property at any time.

Upon completion of the evaluation of the Proposed Transaction, and upon written request by [PLACEHOLDER] or its Representatives (in particular [PLACEHOLDER]) at any time, the Interested Party will promptly return to [PLACEHOLDER] or destroy all documents, data carriers and other materials containing Confidential Information or its Representatives' possession without retaining any copies thereof and erase (to the extent reasonably practicable) all Confidential Information from any computer or other device containing such information.

Unless required otherwise by mandatory law or internal policy, the Interested Party will further destroy all copies of any analyses, studies, reports and other documents, which contain or reflect any Confidential Information.
Upon [PLACEHOLDER]s or its Representatives request the Interested Party will confirm compliance and its Representatives with the obligations under this Section 5 in writing.

Any Confidential Information not returned to [PLACEHOLDER] or its Representatives or destroyed in accordance with this provision shall remain subject to the confidentiality obligations set forth in this Confidentiality Agreement.
No Warranty
The Interested Party acknowledges that the Confidential Information is provided to the Interested Party without any representation or warranty, express or implied, as to accuracy or completeness.
The Confidential Information will be verified by the Interested Party independently.

The Interested Party acknowledges that neither [PLACEHOLDER] nor its Representatives do accept any liability for any conclusions that the Interested Party may derive from the Confidential Information.
No Obligations regarding the Proposed Transaction

The Interested Party agrees that unless and until a definitive and legally binding agreement regarding the Proposed Transaction has been executed, neither the Interested Party nor [PLACEHOLDER] or its Representatives will be under any legal obligation of any kind whatsoever with respect to the Proposed Transaction other than its obligations under this Confidentiality Agreement.

The Interested Party agrees that [PLACEHOLDER] reserves the right, in sole discretion, to reject any and all offers made by the Interested Party or any of its Representatives and to terminate discussions and negotiations with the Interested Party at any time, in each case without giving any reasons for the decision.
[PLACEHOLDER] and its Representatives are free to conduct the process with respect to the Proposed Transaction and change or discontinue such process at any time and at their sole discretion.
Responsibility for Representatives

The Interested Party will ensure that all of its obligations under this Confidentiality Agreement are observed by its Representatives in the same manner as if its Representatives were bound by this Confidentiality Agreement directly.
The Interested Party agrees to be fully responsible for any actions or failures to act by its Representatives which result in a breach of this Confidentiality Agreement.
Term
This Confidentiality Agreement shall terminate two years after the date of this Confidentiality Agreement.
Miscellaneous
The undertakings given by the Interested Party under this Confidentiality Agreement is given for the benefit of [PLACEHOLDER], its affiliates (as defined in Sections 15 cc.
AktG) and its Representatives.

This Confidentiality Agreement contains the entire agreement between the parties concerning the Confidential Information and shall supersede and replace all prior oral and written agreements in respect thereof.
Any changes or amendments to this Confidentiality Agreement (including changes and amendments to this clause) shall be valid only if made in writing, unless another form is required by mandatory law.
This Confidentiality Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the Federal Republic of Germany.
The courts located in Frankfurt/ Main, Germany, shall have exclusive jurisdiction over any and all disputes under or in connection with this Confidentiality Agreement.
If any provision of this Confidentiality Agreement should be invalid or unenforceable, this shall not affect the validity and enforceability of the other provisions of this Confidentiality Agreement.

In such case the Parties agree to recognize and give effect to such valid and enforceable provision or provisions, which reflect as closely as possible the commercial intention of the Parties associated with the invalid or unenforceable provision.
The same shall apply in the event that this Confidentiality Agreement contains any omissions (Vertragslücken).

FROM: [PLACEHOLDER] of [PLACEHOLDER] (the Provider)
TO: (the Recipient)
Dear Sirs
The potential acquisition of [PLACEHOLDER] (the Acquisition)
We refer to our discussions in relation to the Acquisition.

In consideration of the Provider agreeing to make available to the Recipient certain information in order for the Recipient to evaluate whether to proceed with the Acquisition (the Permitted Purpose), the Recipient agrees with the Provider as follows:
CONFIDENTIALITY UNDERTAKING
The Recipient undertakes with the Provider:

to keep the Confidential Information confidential and not to disclose it to anyone except as provided for by paragraph 2 below and to ensure that the Confidential Information is protected with security measures and a degree of care that would apply to the Recipient's own confidential information;

to keep confidential and not disclose to anyone the fact that the Confidential Information has been made available to you or that discussions or negotiations are taking place or have taken place between you and the Provider in connection with the Acquisition;
and
to use the Confidential Information only for the Permitted Purpose.
PERMITTED DISCLOSURE
The Provider agrees that the Recipient may disclose Confidential Information:

to members of the Recipient's Participant Group and their respective officers, directors, employees and professional advisers to the extent necessary for the Permitted Purpose and to any auditors of members of the Recipient's Participant Group, provided that each such recipient is informed in writing of its confidential nature (except that there shall be no such requirement to so inform if the recipient is subject to professional obligations to maintain the confidentiality of the information or is otherwise bound by requirements of confidentiality in relation to the Confidential Information) or;
where requested or required by any court of competent jurisdiction or any competent judicial, governmental, supervisory or regulatory body;
or
where required by the rules of any stock exchange on which the shares or other securities of any member of the Recipient's Participant Group are listed;
or
where required by the laws or regulations of any country with jurisdiction over the affairs of any member of the Recipient's Participant Group;
or
with the prior written consent of the Provider.
NOTIFICATION OF REQUIRED OR UNAUTHORISED DISCLOSURE
The Recipient agrees (to the extent permitted by law) to inform the Provider of the terms of:

of the circumstances of any disclosure under sub-paragraphs 2(b) to 2(d) (inclusive) above, except where such disclosure is made to any of the persons referred to in those paragraphs during the ordinary course of its supervisory or regulatory function;
and
upon becoming aware that Confidential Information has been disclosed in breach of this letter.
RETURN OF COPIES

If the Provider so requests of the Recipient in writing, the Recipient will return to the Provider or (as the Provider may reasonably direct) destroy all Confidential Information supplied to the Recipient by the Provider (or any member of the Provider's Group) or on the Provider's behalf and (to the extent technically practicable) destroy or permanently erase all copies of Confidential Information made by the Provider and use all reasonable endeavours to ensure that anyone to whom the Recipient has supplied any Confidential Information destroys or permanently erases such Confidential Information and any copies made by them, in each case save to the extent that the Recipient or the recipients are required to retain any such Confidential Information by any applicable law, rule or regulation or by any competent judicial, governmental, supervisory or regulatory body, or where the Confidential Information has been disclosed under sub-paragraphs 2(b) to 2(d) (inclusive) above.
CONTINUING OBLIGATIONS
The obligations in this letter are continuing and, in particular, shall survive the termination of any discussions or negotiations between the Provider and the Recipient.
Notwithstanding the previous sentence, the obligations in this letter shall cease thirty six months after the date of this letter.
NO REPRESENTATION;
CONSEQUENCES OF BREACH, ETC
The Recipient acknowledges and agrees with the Provider that neither the Provider nor any of the Provider's officers, employees or advisers (each a Relevant Person):

makes any representation or warranty, express or implied, as to, or assume any responsibility for, the accuracy, reliability or completeness of any of the Confidential Information or any other information supplied by the Provider or the assumptions on which it is based;
or

shall be under any obligation to update or correct any inaccuracy in the Confidential Information or any other information supplied by the Provider or be otherwise liable to the Recipient or any other person in respect to the Confidential Information or any such information.

Each party to this letter acknowledges to the other that such other (and members of the Group or Participant Group, as applicable) may be irreparably harmed by the breach of the terms of this letter and damages may not be an adequate remedy;
each Relevant Person may be granted an injunction or specific performance for any threatened or actual breach of the provisions of this letter by the Recipient.
NO WAIVER;
AMENDMENTS, ETC

This letter sets out the full extent of the Recipient's obligations owed to the Provider in relation to the Confidential Information and supersedes any previous agreement, whether express or implied, regarding Confidential Information.

No failure or delay in exercising any right, power or privilege under this letter will operate as a waiver thereof nor will any single or partial exercise of any right, power or privilege preclude any further exercise thereof or the exercise of any other right, power or privileges under this letter.
The terms of this letter and the Recipient's obligations under this letter may only be amended or modified by written agreement between the Provider and the Recipient.
NATURE OF UNDERTAKINGS
The undertakings given by each party to this letter to the other are also given to each member of the Group or Participant Group (as applicable).
Each party to this letter agrees (at its own expense) to do all such acts and things necessary or desirable to give effect to the terms of this letter.
BENEFIT

Subject to paragraph 7 above, the terms of this letter may be enforced and relied upon only by the Provider and the Recipient and the operation of the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act 1999 is excluded.

Notwithstanding any provisions of this letter, the parties to this letter do not require the consent of any Relevant Person or any member of the Group or Participant Group to rescind or vary this letter at any time.
Neither party may assign the benefit of the terms of this letter.
COUNTERPARTS
This letter may be executed in any number of counterparts.
This has the same effect as if the signatures on the counterparts were on a single copy of this letter.
GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION

This letter (including the agreement constituted by each party's acknowledgement of its terms) and any non-contractual obligations arising out of or in connection therewith (including any non-contractual obligations arising out of the negotiation of any transaction contemplated by this letter) are governed by English law.

The courts of England have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any dispute arising out of or in connection with this letter (including a dispute relating to any non-contractual obligations arising out of or in connection with either this letter or the negotiation of the Acquisition).
DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATION
In this letter (including the acknowledgement set out below):

is known by the Recipient, any member of the Participant Group and/or their respective advisers before the date the information is disclosed to the Recipient by the Provider or is lawfully obtained by the Recipient, any member of the Participant Group and/or their respective advisers after that date, other than from a source which is connected with the Group,
and which, in either case, as far as the Recipient is aware, has not been obtained in violation of, and is not otherwise subject to, any obligation of confidentiality.
Group means the Provider and each member of its each of its corporate group or affiliated entities under common control or management with the Provider.

Participant Group means, in respect of the Recipient, each of its holding companies and subsidiaries and each subsidiary of each of its holding companies (as each such term is defined in the Companies Act 2006).
Please acknowledge your agreement to the above by signing and returning the enclosed copy.
Yours faithfully, for and on behalf of [PLACEHOLDER]

DATE
PARTIES
[PLACEHOLDER];
and
[NAME OF COMPANY] (incorporated and registered in [England and Wales] under company registration number [COMPANY NUMBER]), the registered office of which is at [REGISTERED OFFICE ADDRESS].
DISCLOSURE
The parties wish to exchange information with each other relating to a direct or indirect interest in Monk Bridge, Leeds (the "Proposed Transaction").
In this agreement:

"Confidential Information" means all information in whatever form (including, without limitation, in written, documentary or electronic form) relating to the Proposed Transaction which is, whether before or after the date of this agreement, supplied or made available, directly or indirectly, to the Recipient or its Professional Advisers;
"Professional Advisers" means a party's lawyers, surveyors, accountants and other professional advisers;
"Provider" means a party to this agreement which discloses or makes available directly or indirectly Confidential Information;
"Recipient" means a party to this agreement which receives or obtains directly or indirectly Confidential Information.
In consideration of the Provider agreeing to disclose Confidential Information to the Recipient, the Recipient undertakes to the Provider that it shall:

1 subject to clauses 3 and 4, hold the Confidential Information in strict confidence and accept that the Confidential Information is commercially sensitive and that its release otherwise than in accordance with the terms of this agreement may be detrimental to the Provider;

2 not disclose or permit to be disclosed any of the Confidential Information to any person or make any announcement other than as permitted by this agreement and not to use the Confidential Information in any way, except for or in connection with, the Proposed Transaction;
and

3 keep confidential the existence and contents of this agreement and of any discussions or negotiations between the Recipient and the Provider in respect of the Proposed Transaction save where disclosure is permitted by this agreement.
TERM AND TERMINATION

The parties' obligations under this agreement shall terminate (save in respect of the obligations in clause 1.3 which shall continue in respect of any Confidential Information retained pursuant to clause 5.2) on the earlier of:
1 two years after the date of this agreement;
and
2 exchange of an agreement containing confidentiality provisions relating to the Proposed Transaction,
such termination shall be without prejudice to any antecedent breach of either party of its obligations in this agreement.
Clause 2.1 shall apply whether or not the Proposed Transaction proceeds.
PERMITTED DISCLOSURE
The Recipient may disclose or permit to be disclosed Confidential Information to:

1 where necessary in connection with the Proposed Transaction, any subsidiary or parent undertaking of the Recipient (whether direct or indirect), any subsidiary undertaking of such parent, any partnership interest in or of the Recipient (the "Recipient Group"), any partner, trustee, nominee, operator, funder or arranger of equity or debt or investment manager or investment adviser to and/or of the Recipient or the Recipient Group or any funds managed or advised by, or clients of, the Recipient or the Recipient Group in each case from time to time;
2 the Professional Advisers engaged by the Recipient or the Recipient Group in respect of the Proposed Transaction;
and
3 any of its or any member of the Recipient Group's officers, directors and necessary employees in connection with the Proposed Transaction,
provided that it procures that each such person to whom the Confidential Information is disclosed complies with the obligations set out in this agreement as if they were the Recipient.

The Recipient shall inform the Provider as soon as reasonably practicable upon becoming aware that a person to whom disclosure of Confidential Information is not permitted under this agreement, has become aware of Confidential Information.
Each party may disclose the Confidential Information to the minimum extent required by:
1 any order of any court of competent jurisdiction or any regulatory, judicial, governmental or similar body or taxation authority of competent jurisdiction;
2 the rules of any listing authority or stock exchange on which its shares or the shares of any member of the Recipient Group are listed;
or
3 the laws or regulations of any country to which its affairs are subject,
provided always that the Recipient informs the Provider of the disclosure, to the extent legally permissible, as soon as reasonably practicable.
EXCLUSIONS
The obligations set out in clause 1 shall not apply, or shall cease to apply, to Confidential Information which the Recipient can show to the Provider's reasonable satisfaction:
is or becomes generally available to the public other than as a direct or indirect result of the information being disclosed by the Recipient in breach of this agreement;
or

was in the Recipient's or any member of the Recipient Group's or any of its or their Professional Advisers' actual possession prior to the time of disclosure to the Recipient and which was lawfully acquired other than from the Provider or on behalf of it and that such source was not under any obligation of confidence in respect of that information;
or

has been received or developed by the Recipient or any member of the Recipient Group or any of its or their Professional Advisers from a third party source that is not connected with the Provider and that such source was not under any obligation of confidence in respect of that information.
RETURN OF THE CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION
The Recipient shall as soon as reasonably practicable on receipt of a written request from the Provider return any Confidential Information received in hard copy to the Provider.

Nothing in clause 5.1 shall require the Recipient or any member of the Recipient Group or any of its or their Professional Advisers to destroy or, prohibit it from keeping a copy of, any Confidential Information:

1 which is held on any back-ups or archives of any computer system containing or previously containing the Confidential Information where such back-up or archiving occurs in the usual course of operating that computer system and where it is not reasonably practicable to delete the Confidential Information so held;

2 which the Recipient or any member of the Recipient Group or any of its or their Professional Advisers are required to retain for professional indemnity insurance purposes, internal audit processes or internal governance purposes;
and

3 which the Recipient or any member of the Recipient Group or any of its or their Professional Advisers are required to retain by any competent judicial, governmental, regulatory or similar body or the rules or regulations of any listing authority or stock exchange on which the securities of the Recipient are listed or traded or for the purposes of any audit, provided always that nothing in this clause 5 shall prejudice the Recipient's obligation contained in clause 1.3.
NO REPRESENTATION OR WARRANTY

Each party acknowledges that the Confidential Information may not be accurate or complete and neither the Provider nor its Professional Advisers accept responsibility or liability for (or make any warranty or representation, express or implied, with respect to) the accuracy or completeness of the Confidential Information.

The Recipient acknowledges that damages alone may not be an adequate remedy for any breach of its obligations under this agreement and, accordingly, without prejudice to any other rights or remedies that the Provider might seek, the Provider shall be entitled to the remedies of injunction, specific performance and other equitable relief for any threatened or actual breach of the provisions of this agreement.
MISCELLANEOUS

The Recipient acknowledges that some or all of the Confidential Information is or may be price-sensitive information and that the use of such information may be regulated or prohibited by applicable legislation relating to insider dealing and the Recipient undertakes not to use any Confidential Information for any unlawful purpose.
[Name of Company] undertakes not to purchase any shares, loans, or other financial instruments issued by or to [PLACEHOLDER].

The Recipient undertakes that it will not during the term hereof directly or indirectly initiate, solicit, negotiate, contract or enter into any business transactions, agreements or undertakings with any third party associated with the Transaction or seek to by-pass, compete, avoid or circumvent the Provider from any business opportunity that relates to the Proposed Transaction.
The terms of this agreement may only be amended or modified by written agreement between the parties.
This agreement does not give rise to any rights under the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act 1999 to enforce any term of this agreement.

This agreement is personal to the parties and neither party shall assign, transfer, charge or deal in any other manner with this agreement or any of its rights under it nor purport to do any of the same.
This agreement and any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with it or its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes or claims) are governed by the law of England.

The Provider and the Recipient irrevocably agree that the courts of England have exclusive jurisdiction to determine any dispute or claim that arises out of or in connection with this agreement or its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes or claims).

PRINCIPAL NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT
[PLACEHOLDER] FEBRUARY 2017

The undersigned has been advised that [PLACEHOLDER](trading as "[PLACEHOLDER]"), is soliciting offers for the purchase of the entities holding [PLACEHOLDER] (the "Property") from [PLACEHOLDER] ("Owner").
The Owner has indicated that all inquiries and communications with respect to the contemplated sale of such Property be directed to [PLACEHOLDER].
All fees due [PLACEHOLDER] in connection with the sale of the Property shall be paid by the Owner.

The undersigned hereby acknowledges that it is a principal or an investment advisor in connection with the possible acquisition of the Property and agrees that it will not look to the Owner or [PLACEHOLDER] for any fees or commissions in connection with the sale of the Property.

The undersigned also hereby acknowledges that it has not dealt with any broker, other than [PLACEHOLDER], regarding the acquisition of the Property, or if it has, the undersigned hereby agrees to indemnify the Owner and [PLACEHOLDER] against any compensation, liability or expense, arising from claims by any other broker or other party the undersigned had dealings with (excluding [PLACEHOLDER]) in connection with the sale of the Property.
[PLACEHOLDER] has available for review certain information ("Confidential Information") concerning the Property.
On behalf of the Owner, [PLACEHOLDER] may make such Confidential Information available to the undersigned upon execution of this Non-Disclosure Agreement.
The Confidential Information is intended solely for your own limited use in considering whether to pursue negotiations to acquire the Property.
This is not an agreement to sell the Property or an offer of sale.

No agreement binding upon the Owner of the Property, or any of its associated or affiliated companies, shall be deemed to exist, at law or equity, until the Owner of the Property enters into a formal binding agreement of sale.

The Confidential Information contains brief, selected information pertaining to the business and affairs of the Owner, and has been prepared by [PLACEHOLDER], primarily from information supplied by the Owner or the Owner's agent.
It does not purport to be all-inclusive or to contain all the information which a prospective purchaser may desire.

Neither [PLACEHOLDER], nor the Owner make any representation or warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy or completeness of the Confidential Information and no legal liability is assumed or to be implied with respect thereto.

By executing this Non-Disclosure Agreement you agree that the Confidential Information provided is confidential, that you will hold and treat it in the strictest of confidence, and that you will not disclose or permit anyone else to disclose the Confidential Information to any person, firm or entity without prior written authorization of the Owner and [PLACEHOLDER].

Notwithstanding the foregoing, you may disclose the Confidential Information to your directors, accountants, advisors, partners, employees and legal counsel ("Representatives") for the purposes of your evaluation of the proposed transaction, provided that you shall direct such Representatives to treat the Confidential Information in a manner consistent with your obligations under this agreement and be liable for any failure on their part to do so.

If any court or governmental authority requires you to disclose any portion of the Confidential Information, you shall, to the extent permitted by law and legal process, (a) provide the Owner with prompt written notice of such requirement and (b) cooperate with the Owner in a commercially reasonable manner in obtaining any protective order or other remedy sought by the Owner with respect to such requirement.

If no such protective order or other remedy is obtained, then you may disclose only that portion of the Confidential Information that in the reasonable opinion of your legal counsel is legally required to be disclosed, and shall exercise all commercially reasonable efforts to obtain reliable assurance that confidential treatment will be accorded the Confidential Information.

You further agree not to discuss the proposed transaction with any tenant, lender, servicer, special servicer, investor, partner or ground lessor of, or agent for, the Property without prior written consent of Owner.

Owner expressly reserves the right in its sole discretion to reject any or all proposals or expressions of interest in the property and to terminate discussions with any party at any time with or without notice.
This agreement shall expire after one year.

If you do not wish to pursue acquisition negotiations you hereby agree to return the Confidential Information to [PLACEHOLDER] provided that you may retain one copy of the Confidential Information for the purposes of and for so long as is required by any applicable law or regulation, on the condition that such Confidential Information is accessible only to your legal compliance personnel.

Money damages may not be a sufficient remedy for the breach of this agreement, and the Owner is entitled to seek specific performance and injunctive relief or other available equitable relief as a remedy for any such breach.
The Owner may enforce the terms of this Non-Disclosure Agreement in accordance with the provisions of the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act 1999.
This Non-Disclosure Agreement is governed by, and shall be construed in accordance with, the laws of England.

You agree that the courts of England have jurisdiction to settle any disputes in connection with this Non-Disclosure Agreement and accordingly submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English courts and waive any defence of inconvenient forum which may be available.
For recipients based in the European Union the Confidential Information is distributed by [PLACEHOLDER]trading as "[PLACEHOLDER]".
For recipients based in the United States the Confidential Information is distributed by [PLACEHOLDER].
If you are in agreement with the foregoing, please return one original signed copy of this agreement to [PLACEHOLDER] (Attention: [PLACEHOLDER], [PLACEHOLDER], [PLACEHOLDER]; Email: [PLACEHOLDER];

Dear Sirs,
Confidentiality and Framework Agreement

We refer to our proposed discussions with you concerning the possibility of entering into potential transactions and/or mutual business opportunities in respect of our respective businesses (the "Transactions" and "Transaction" shall be construed accordingly).

In connection with the Transactions, and in consideration of the provision by each party of Confidential Information (as defined below) to the other, both parties agree to make certain information available to the other on the terms set out in this letter in order to conduct due diligence and investigate the viability of such Transactions.
In this letter:

"Confidential Information" means all Information relating directly or indirectly to (i) [PLACEHOLDER] or any member of its Group, and (ii) [PLACEHOLDER] or any member of its Group and any Transaction (including the existence of any Transaction and this letter and of the discussions and negotiations between us and the willingness of each of us to enter into such discussions and negotiations with each other or any other party) which is disclosed by or acquired in any way (and whether directly or indirectly) from or on behalf of the Provider and includes all copies of any such Information and Information prepared by the Recipient which contains or otherwise reflects or is generated from such Information but excluding:
all Information that is or comes into the public domain other than as a result of a breach of the terms of this letter by the Recipient or any of its Representatives;

all Information that was in the possession of the Recipient or any of its Representatives prior to disclosure by the Provider, provided that such Information was not known by the Recipient or such Representative to be bound by any confidentiality obligation to the Provider in respect of such Information;

all Information that is disclosed to the Recipient or any of its Representatives by a third party, provided that the source of such Information was not known by the Recipient or such Representative to be bound by any confidentiality obligation to the Provider in respect of such Information;

all Information that is independently developed by the Recipient or any of its Representatives without any breach of this letter, as reasonably evidenced by the Recipient's records or demonstrated, acting reasonably and in good faith;
or
all Information which is the subject of a written permission to disclose provided by the Provider;

"Groups" means in relation to a company, that company, any subsidiary or any holding company from time to time of that company, and any subsidiary from time to time of a holding company of that company, and the terms "member of its Group" and "Group member" shall be construed accordingly;

"Information" means all information of whatever nature and in whatever form including, without limitation, in writing, orally, electronically and in a visual or machine-readable medium including CD ROM, magnetic and digital form;

"Provider" means, as the context requires, that one of us (either directly or indirectly through any of its Representatives) who provides any Information to the Recipient or any of its Representatives;

"Recipient" means, as the context requires, either one of us (and/or its Representatives) who receives Information (either directly or indirectly) from or on behalf of the Provider or any of its Representatives;
and

"Representatives" means, in respect of either party, its Group members and its and its Group members' respective directors, officers, employees, affiliates, attorneys, accountants, provided that, for the purposes of this letter, none of such persons shall be deemed a "Representative" hereunder, nor shall a party have any liability for such person, unless such person has been furnished with Confidential Information hereunder.

For avoidance of doubt, a Recipient's Representatives shall not include any consultants, professional advisers or potential debt and/or equity funding sources ("Outside Representatives") unless such persons are (i) listed on Schedule A attached hereto, or (ii) consented in writing (including by e-mail) by the Provider.
The Recipient shall:

keep all Confidential Information as secret and confidential and shall not disclose or directly or indirectly communicate (whether in writing or orally or in any other manner) any Confidential Information to any other person other than as provided for in paragraph 3.

NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT
The Transaction.

[PLACEHOLDER] is considering the sale of a portfolio of real estate logistic assets (the "Portfolio"), owned by [PLACEHOLDER] and its affiliates, through a sales process in which reputable investors will be invited to participate (the "Process").
Executing the Non-disclosure Agreement.

As a condition for having access to information and documentation in relation to the Transaction, we kindly ask you as interested investor ("Investor") to execute this non-disclosure agreement (the "Non-disclosure Agreement") whereby the Investor undertakes to keep the Transaction strictly confidential in the terms and conditions set out herein.
No representation.

The Non-disclosure Agreement does not (i) constitute any representation, guarantee or commitment, whether express or implicit, conferred by [PLACEHOLDER] (or its affiliates) in relation to the Transaction, or (ii) confer any right in relation to the Transaction and/or the Process upon the Investor.[PLACEHOLDER] expressly reserves the right to restrict the Investor's access to the Confidential Information and/or request the Investor to return the Confidential Information, at any time, at [PLACEHOLDER] sole discretion and without any prior notice.
[PLACEHOLDER] Advisers.
[PLACEHOLDER] has appointed [PLACEHOLDER], as commercial adviser for the Transaction.
CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION
Definition of Confidential Information.
All information and/or documentation regarding the Transaction is owned by [PLACEHOLDER].

By virtue of this Non-disclosure Agreement, any information or documentation, in any format, support or medium (printed, electronic, digital, photographic, verbal or any others) that [PLACEHOLDER], and/or its Advisors, make available to the Investor with regard to (i) the Transaction, (ii) the Process, and/or (iii) the Portfolio, will be deemed confidential (the "Confidential Information").
Exemptions.

The term Confidential Information does not include information or documentation which: (i) is available to the general public, provided that this is not the result of the disclosure thereof by the Investor in breach of this Non-disclosure Agreement; (ii) was in the Investor's possession prior to its participation in the Process;
or (iii) was available to the Investor through a lawful source other than [PLACEHOLDER].
Non-liability.
The Confidential Information will be made available to the Investor for solely informative purposes, and [PLACEHOLDER] does not guarantee its accuracy, truthfulness or completeness.

Therefore, the Investor (i) acknowledges and accepts that [PLACEHOLDER] will not be held liable for the accuracy, truthfulness, or completeness of the Confidential Information, and (ii) waives the right to file any claim vis-à-vis [PLACEHOLDER] or its Advisers with regard to the Confidential Information.

Notwithstanding this, [PLACEHOLDER] may, if necessary, consider the possibility of making specific representations and warranties in relation to the Confidential Information contained in the public deed of sale and purchase which may be executed with the Investor who, as the case may be, acquires the Portfolio.
UNDERTAKINGS
By virtue of this Non-disclosure Agreement, the Investor undertakes the following:
Duty of Confidentiality.
The Investor will maintain the confidentiality of the Confidential Information.

Notwithstanding the general nature of the above, the Investor may not divulge, transfer, communicate, exchange and generally disclose to third parties or to other investors (i) the Confidential Information, (ii) its participation in the Process, (iii) the analyses, studies or reviews carried out by the Investor in relation to the Process and/or the Portfolio, (iv) its offers to acquire the Portfolio, (v) its sources of funding, (vi) its exclusion or withdrawal from the Process, as well as (vii) the economic and financial data analysed for the decision making, as the case may be.
Purpose and security.

The Confidential Information must be treated as such and must at all times be diligently kept and maintained by the Investor during the term of this Non-disclosure Agreement, taking appropriate measures to prevent unauthorised access, use, disclosure and publication of the above-mentioned information.

The investor must use the Confidential Information solely and exclusively for the purpose of evaluating its interest in the Transaction and not for any other reason, acting with the due diligence exercised by the Investor in order to custody its own confidential information.
Authorised Recipients.
Authorised Recipients.

The Investor may disclose the Confidential Information solely and exclusively to (i) the Investor's employees or those of other companies of the same group, decision-making bodies, auditors and the Investor's Supervisory Authorities, (ii) external consultants or advisers appointed by the Investor to provide advice thereto on the Transaction (the "Investor's Advisers"), and (iii) financial institutions which may be interested in providing funds to the Investor for the Transaction (the "Financial Institutions").
Notifications regarding the duty of confidentiality.

Whenever the Investor discloses the Confidential Information to the Authorised Recipients in accordance with the provisions of this section, it must notify them in advance of the existence of this Non-disclosure Agreement and the obligation of the Authorised Recipients to adhere to it.
List of companies with access to the Confidential Information.

The Investor shall provide a list of its Authorised Recipients (entities only) who have received the Confidential Information, which the Investor must keep up to date, and it undertakes to send [PLACEHOLDER] a list thereof upon its written request in the event of a dispute hereunder.
Mandatory Disclosure.

In the event that the Investor is requested by a Court, administrative body or Public Authority to disclose any Confidential Information, the Investor will diligently comply with said request, without said compliance being considered contrary to the duty of confidentiality established in herein.
If permitted by law, the Investor will notify [PLACEHOLDER] regarding said request as soon as possible so that [PLACEHOLDER] can timely consider appropriate measures to defend its interests.
Returning or destruction the Confidential Information.

Within five (5) business days following the relevant request from [PLACEHOLDER], the Investor must return to [PLACEHOLDER] all of the Confidential Information which has been provided thereto until that time, including but not limited to, all of the copies and/or extracts of such Confidential Information, and must destroy or delete from its computers files all of the information and documentation which the Investor or its Authorised Recipients may have drawn up based on the Confidential Information.

Exceptions to the above include documents which are strictly necessary to certify, on an accounting or fiscal basis, any expenses the Investor may have incurred with regard to the Transaction, computer-related back-ups or data, or Confidential Information which the Investor must maintain in accordance with applicable legal or regulatory requirements.
However, in this case, the Investor will only be entitled to use such Confidential Information for those exclusive and specific purposes.
Liability.

The Investor will be liable to [PLACEHOLDER] for (a) any breaches committed by the Investor under this Non-disclosure Agreement, and (b) any breaches committed by the Authorised Recipients under this Non-disclosure Agreement, excluding any breaches by the Investor's Advisers and Financial Institutions that have executed a deed of adherence to this Non-disclosure Agreement as if they were an original party hereto, and the Investor will not be liable for any such breaches, notwithstanding [PLACEHOLDER] right to directly file a claim against them.
Breach.

Notwithstanding the liabilities that may derive from the breach of this Non-disclosure Agreement by the Investor, [PLACEHOLDER] may exclude the Investor from the Process in the event of non-compliance with any obligations undertaken under this Confidentiality Agreement.
Term.
The obligations deriving from this Non-disclosure Agreement will remain in force for a period of two (2) years as from the date hereof.

The party to which Receiving Party discloses the Information is a Permitted Party.

and

Definitions

Handling of Confidential Information
In consideration of the disclosure of the Confidential Information, the Recipient undertakes in relation to the Owner's Confidential Information:

1 To maintain the same in confidence and to use it only in connection with the Transaction and for no other purpose and in particular, but without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, not to make any commercial use thereof or use the same for the benefit of itself or any third party other than pursuant to a further written agreement with the Owner;

2 Not to copy reproduce or reduce to writing or electronic form any part thereof except as may be reasonably necessary in connection with the Transaction and that any copies reproductions or reductions to writing or electronic form so made shall be the property of the Owner;

3 Only to disclose the same to its employees and/or employees of its Associated Companies who need to know the same in connection with the Transaction and only then where such employees are put on notice that such information is confidential and such employees are bound by obligations of confidentiality under their contracts with the Recipient not to disclose the same.

4 Save as expressly permitted above not to use, disclose, copy in whole or in part or modify or adapt the Confidential Information in any way.
5 For the avoidance of doubt the obligations of confidentiality herein contained shall continue to subsist after the termination of this Agreement without time limit.
Return of Confidential Information

Upon request of the Owner at any time the Owner may require the Recipient to cease all use of the Confidential Information and in such event the Recipient will return to the Owner (or destroy as the Owner may direct) such of the original versions of the Confidential Information and copies thereof that are in its possession, power or custody, all documents and materials (and all copies thereof) containing the Owner's Confidential Information and certify in writing to the Owner that it has complied with the requirements of this clause.
This Agreement may at all times be terminated by Notice of either party to the other with immediate effect or otherwise as the party giving the Notice may reasonably determine.
Information available from other Sources
The Recipient's obligations under clause 3 above do not apply to and the term "Confidential Information" shall be deemed to exclude, any information which the Recipient can prove:

and/or

It is acknowledged and agreed by the Co-investor that [PLACEHOLDER] Representatives (as defined below) may disclose confidential information regarding the Transaction and [PLACEHOLDER] only strictly within the limits (which are to be agreed at a later stage) of [PLACEHOLDER]'s own confidentiality obligations towards [PLACEHOLDER].

Co-investor Representative shall mean any director, officer, partner or employee or other firm-personnel of the Co-investor, any subsidiary, affiliate or branch of the Co-investor (and any of their directors, officers, partners or employees) or any other representatives of the Co-investor

The fact that [PLACEHOLDER] is contemplating the Transaction and the content of any related discussions and negotiations shall also be considered Information for the purposes of this Confidentiality Undertaking.

In consideration of [PLACEHOLDER] agreeing to make Information available to the Co-investor and the Co-investor Representatives, the Co-investor agrees for the benefit of [PLACEHOLDER] to the following:
USE AND DISCLOSURE OF INFORMATION
The Co-investor shall treat all Information as secret and confidential and shall prevent any unauthorised disclosure of and any unauthorised access to Information.
The Co-investor may not publicly refer to the Information or any part thereof, nor distribute or disclose any part of the Information.

The Co-investor may not, without the prior consent of [PLACEHOLDER], disclose, exploit or otherwise make available Information, whether in whole or in part, to any third parties other than to such Co-investor Representatives that are working on or consulted in connection with such Information for the Purpose.
In connection with any such disclosure, the Co-investor shall ensure that the individuals to whom the Information is disclosed are made aware of the confidential nature of the Information.
The Co-investor shall be responsible for any breach of this Confidentiality Undertaking by the Co-investor Representatives.
The Co-investor and the Co-investor Representatives to whom Information is disclosed may only use such Information for the Purpose.

The Co-investor acknowledges that [PLACEHOLDER]'s shares are quoted on Nasdaq Helsinki Ltd and that Information concerning the Transaction and/or [PLACEHOLDER] may constitute insider information (as defined in Article 7 of the Market Abuse Regulation (Regulation (EU) No 596/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 April 2014, the MAR) (the Insider Information).
The disclosure and/or misuse of Insider Information may constitute criminal offences under applicable laws.

The Co-investor acknowledges its obligations to ensure that all applicable laws, rules and regulations with regard to insider dealing are complied with by the Co-investor and the Co-investor Representatives in relation to Insider Information of [PLACEHOLDER].

Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, The Co-investor represents that it maintains procedures to ensure that all individuals who are informed of the Transaction and/or given access to Insider Information shall refrain from acting in any manner that could breach applicable securities laws, rules or regulations, and that Insider Information is only disclosed in compliance with MAR, in particular Article 10 thereof.
The Co-investor undertakes to comply with Article 11 of MAR and other procedural guidelines relating to market sounding in connection with any possible market sounding activities.

Further, the Co-investor undertakes to keep appropriate insider list (as set out in Article 18 of MAR and the Helsinki Takeover Code) of the Co-investor Representatives that have and/or will receive Insider Information.
The Co-investor shall, to the extent permitted by law, notify [PLACEHOLDER] of any breach of this Section 1 without delay upon the Co-investor becoming aware of any such breach.
EXCEPTIONS

Without limiting the statutory obligations relating to the Insider Information as set forth in Sections 1.4 and 1.5 above, the obligations of the Co-investor under Section 1 will not restrict the use of Information to the extent that the Information:

is in or enters into the public domain other than by reason of a breach of this Confidentiality Undertaking by the Co-investor or a Co-investor Representative or any other party to whom such Information has been disclosed;

was already lawfully in the Co-investor's possession without disclosure restrictions prior to the date of receipt of such Information, as evidenced by the Co-investor's written records or other reasonable evidence;
is obtained by the Co-investor from a third party which is lawfully entitled to disclose such Information without any restriction on its disclosure;

is required to be disclosed by applicable mandatory laws, regulations, by order of a court or a regulatory authority of competent jurisdiction, the rules and regulations of a stock exchange, or pursuant to legal proceedings;

OBLIGATION TO RETURN AND DESTROY INFORMATION

copies of any computer records and files that contain Information and that have been created pursuant to automatic back-up procedures.

Neither the return of Information nor the expunging of the same from any records will release the Co-investor or the Co-investor Representatives from their other obligations under this Confidentiality Undertaking.

CONTACTS

The Co-investor shall not, without the prior written (including email) consent of [PLACEHOLDER], contact, and shall cause the Co-investor Representatives to not contact, any directors, officers, employees or other representatives or shareholders of a company belonging to the [PLACEHOLDER] Group or [PLACEHOLDER], or any of their respective affiliates, whether regarding the Transaction or the Engagement.

Notwithstanding the aforesaid, this Section 4 does not prohibit such contacts that take place in the ordinary course of business and do not in any way relate or refer to the Transaction or the Purpose.
TERM OF UNDERTAKING

The obligations of the Co-investor under this Confidentiality Undertaking shall commence upon the Co-investor signing this Confidentiality Undertaking and shall remain in force for a period of three (3) years from the date hereof.
GOVERNING LAW AND SETTLEMENT OF DISPUTES
This Confidentiality Undertaking is governed by the laws of Finland, without regard to its conflicts of laws rules and principles.

Any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of or relating to this Confidentiality Undertaking, or the breach, termination or validity thereof, shall be finally settled by arbitration in accordance with the Arbitration Rules of the Finland Chamber of Commerce.

[PLACEHOLDER], located at [PLACEHOLDER], ("[PLACEHOLDER]") and its affiliates, on the one hand, and [[PLACEHOLDER]], located at [insert address] (the "Company"), on the other, desire to commence certain preliminary, non-binding discussions concerning the Company's possible involvement in a transaction (the "Transaction") to directly or indirectly provide financing to, invest in and/or acquire the real estate asset or assets referred to as Project [PLACEHOLDER], located in [PLACEHOLDER] (the "Project").

It is understood and acknowledged that in the course of discussions regarding the Transaction and in relation to the Project, [PLACEHOLDER] has provided and/or may provide the Company with information which is not available to the general public concerning, among other things, the Project, the Transaction, [PLACEHOLDER], its affiliates and their respective shareholders, business, assets, clients and operations.

In particular, as used herein "Confidential Information" means (in whatever format whether written, oral, electronic or in any other medium) all information, data, interpretations, forecasts and records containing or otherwise reflecting information concerning the Project, the Transaction, [PLACEHOLDER], its affiliates and each of their respective shareholders, owners, principals, investors, partners, directors, officers, employees, agents, advisors, clients, businesses, business practices, management policies, assets and any and all other proprietary information of each of them which is not available to the general public and which [PLACEHOLDER] or its Representatives (as defined below) has provided or may provide to the Company in the course of the discussions regarding the Project and/or the Transaction, together with any and all analyses, compilations, studies or other documents, whether prepared by [PLACEHOLDER], its Representatives, the Company or its Representatives which contain or otherwise reflect such information.

The Confidential Information shall include the fact that discussions are taking place concerning the Transaction, the terms of such discussions, that this Confidentiality Agreement (this "Agreement") has been entered into and the fact that Confidential Information has been provided to the Company.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, information which is in the public domain other than as a result of disclosure by the Company or its Representatives in violation of this Agreement will not constitute Confidential Information for purposes of this Agreement.

In consideration of [PLACEHOLDER] providing the Company with Confidential Information and for such other consideration deemed relevant by the parties, the Company agrees that all of the Confidential Information will be held and treated by the Company in strict confidence and will not be disclosed to any other person other than as expressly permitted by this Agreement;
the Company will also insure that Confidential Information is processed in compliance with applicable data protection laws.
In addition, except to the extent that [PLACEHOLDER] consents otherwise, the Company shall use the Confidential Information solely in connection with its evaluation of the Transaction.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Company may disclose the Confidential Information solely to those of its affiliates and its and their respective directors, officers, employees and professional advisors (its "Representatives", it being understood that when referring to [PLACEHOLDER], Representatives shall refer to [PLACEHOLDER]'s affiliates and so on) who have a need to know such information solely for the purpose of the Company's evaluation of the Transaction.
The Confidential Information shall be returned to [PLACEHOLDER] or destroyed promptly upon [PLACEHOLDER]'s request;

provided, that the Company shall be entitled to retain a copy of such information as may be required by applicable laws, regulations or the Company's internal control rules and/or policies applicable to information of the Company generally, to the extent access is strictly restricted for such purposes.

If the Company or any of its Representatives is required by law, regulation or stock exchange rule or as a result of the order of any court or other tribunal to disclose any Confidential Information, the Company shall provide [PLACEHOLDER] with prompt advance written notice so that [PLACEHOLDER] may seek, at its option, a protective order with respect to any of the Confidential Information prior to its disclosure.

If a protective order has not been obtained prior to such time that the Confidential Information is required to be disclosed, if [PLACEHOLDER] opts not to pursue one or in any other case, the Company may only disclose that portion of the Confidential Information that it is compelled to disclose.
